newsitem.title: FINLAND: HELSINKI REACHES FOR ONE PCT GAIN, UPM ACTIVE.
newsitem.headline: HELSINKI REACHES FOR ONE PCT GAIN, UPM ACTIVE.

text.p: Shares attempted a one percent
rise on Thursday in the wake of overnight U.S. gains and an
on-hold rate decision from the Fed, with UPM and blue-chips
leading a broad rally, brokers said.
"The general tone is positive -- we could go even higher
today," one broker said, as the FOX index was up about 0.8
percent. He added that the moderate volume was due more to a
scarcity of sellers than any lack of demand.
UPM-Kymmene was the most active share, trading up 1.90
markka at 126.50 after touching 126.80 in heavy 86 million
markka volume.
Brokers said investors were still showing interest in UPM
after its sale last week of a large chunk of Nokia stock,
kindling expectations it may soon make a purchase overseas.
Nokia traded 6.00 markka higher at 390.00, matching its
overnight Wall St close in fair 40 million markka dealings.
Merita fell 0.20 markka to 19.20 after an early assault
above 20.00 markka levels where it ran into profit-takers,
brokers said.
Speculation over a link-up between Merita and insurer Sampo,
which helped boost Merita on Wednesday, had petered out, brokers
said. "The rumour has lost its wings," one said.
Metra joined the bluechip rally, trading up 6.00
markka or 3.75 percent at a year-high 166.00 in lively 19
million markka trade.
Broker said the strong dollar helped boost cyclicals.
Raisio was again volatile, this time paring some of its
recent sharp losses and rising 15.50 markka to 374.00 in fair 14
million markka trade.
"A few big overseas owners have stopped selling Raisio," one
broker said.
